ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Polar Plasma Wave Instrument, High Frequency Waveform Receiver, 2 kHz, Time Domain Fields

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, metadata versioned up to SPASE 2.6.0, reviewed by LFB 20230727

ResourceHeader.Description: PWI>Plasma Wave Instrument Reference: Gurnett, D.A., et al., The Polar Plasma Wave Instrument, Space Science Reviews, Vol. 71, pp. 597-622, 1995. donald-gurnett@uiowa.edu An FFT on 2048 values was used in calibrating the data; i.e., perform FFT, calibrate in frequency domain, perform inverse FFT to get calibrated time series. The coordinate system used is local magnetic field-aligned, a spacecraft centered coordinate system where Z is parallel to the local B-field determined from Polar MFE, X points outward and lies in the plane defined by the Z-axis and the radial vector from the earth to the spacecraft, and Y completes a right-handed system and points eastward. The X- and Z-axes are contained in the north-south plane. Effective Bandwidth is 1.5*delta_f, where delta_f depends on the size of the FFT used to convert to the frequency domain, and delta_t. The unattenuated frequency range for this file type is 20Hz to 2000Hz. These data come in snapshots of 2048 samples per channel, every 128.8 seconds, with a cadence equal to the inverse of the sampling rate (4464 Hz), and individual time tags given in CDF TT2000 format. For a description of the PWI receivers and the different operational modes see https://space.physics.uiowa.edu/plasma-wave/polar/modes.html

PublicationInfo.Authors: Gurnett, Donald, A.; Menietti, J., Douglas

InformationURL.Name: Polar Plasma Wave Investigation (PWI) Data and User's Guides

TimeSpan.Note: The cadence value given here is computed from the inverse of the sampling rate (4464 Hz).

NumericalData.Keyword: CDF Global Attribute TITLE: POLAR PWI HFWR
CDF Global Attribute MISSION_GROUP: Polar CDF Global Attribute MISSION_GROUP: Magnetospheric Data
CDF Global Attribute PROJECT: ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics

Parameter.Name: Time
Parameter.Description: Time, CDF TT2000 time of HFWR 2 kHz value

Parameter.Name: Gain for HFWR Channel 1 (Ex)
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation.

Parameter.Name: Gain for HFWR Channel 2 (Ey)
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation.

Parameter.Name: Gain for HFWR Channel 3 (Ez)
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation.

Parameter.Name: Gain for HFWR 16 kHz M-Field (Bx, By, Bz)
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation.

Parameter.Name: HFWR 2 kHz Elec Field Antenna Ex
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): HFWR Elec Field Antenna Ex (perp and outward in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords).
Parameter.Description: HFWR 2 kHz Elec Field Antenna Ex (perp and outward in Local-Field-Aligned/LFA coords)

Parameter.Name: HFWR 2 kHz Elec. Field Antenna Ey
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): HFWR Elec Field Antenna Ey (perp and eastward in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords).
Parameter.Description: HFWR 2 kHz Elec Field Antenna Ey (perp and eastward in Local-Field-Aligned/LFA coords)

Parameter.Name: HFWR 2 kHz Elec. Field Antenna Ez
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): HFWR Elec Field Antenna Ez (parallel in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords).
Parameter.Description: HFWR 2 kHz Elec Field Antenna Ez (parallel in Local-Field-Aligned/LFA coords)

Parameter.Name: HFWR 2 kHz Mag. Field Antenna Bx
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): HFWR Mag Field Antenna Bx (perp and outward in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords).
Parameter.Description: HFWR 2 kHz Mag Field Antenna Bx (perp and outward in Local-Field-Aligned/LFA coords)

Parameter.Name: HFWR 2 kHz Mag. Field Antenna By
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): HFWR Mag Field Antenna By (perp and eastward in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords).
Parameter.Description: HFWR 2 kHz Mag Field Antenna By (perp and eastward in Local-Field-Aligned/LFA coords)

Parameter.Name: HFWR 2 kHz Mag. Field Antenna Bz
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): HFWR Mag Field Antenna Bz (parallel in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords).
Parameter.Description: HFWR 2 kHz Mag Field Antenna Bz (parallel in Local-Field-Aligned/LFA coords)

Parameter.Name: DATA_QUALITY
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): Data Quality for Ex components (0 = OK, 1 = clipped or questionable).
